readables.name: hunterJournal1
readables.label: Hunter's Journal #1
readables.title: Today was a good day
text: Today I set out early in the morning to hunt elk in the mountains.
The weather was crisp and clear, and the forest was alive with the sounds of nature.
I hiked for hours, following the tracks of a large herd I had spotted the day before.
Finally, I caught sight of my prey, a majestic elk with a massive set of antlers.
I took careful aim and fired, and the elk fell to the ground with a thud.
It was a clean kill, and I was filled with a sense of satisfaction and accomplishment.
I field dressed the elk and began the long trek back to my cabin, loaded down with my prize.
I can't wait to share this story around the campfire tonight and savor the taste of fresh elk meat for dinner.

readables.name: hunterJournal2
readables.label: Hunter's Journal #2
readables.title: Something is off
text: I set out today with the intention of hunting deer, but something felt off from the moment I stepped into the woods.
The animals were all spooked, fleeing at the slightest noise or movement. Even the birds seemed to have gone silent.
As I made my way deeper into the forest, I couldn't shake the feeling that I was being watched.
I heard footsteps behind me that I couldn't account for, and several times I turned around expecting to see someone there, but the woods were empty.
I couldn't shake the feeling that there was a presence in the forest with me, something unseen and malevolent.
My instincts were screaming at me to turn back, but I couldn't bring myself to do it.
I know I should have listened to my gut, but I was determined to hunt my prey.
In the end, I didn't even get a shot off. The deer were too skittish, and I couldn't get close enough.
I returned to my cabin empty-handed and shaken by the experience.
I don't know what to make of it, but I can't shake the feeling that something very wrong is happening in these woods.

readables.name: hunterJournal3
readables.label: Hunter's Journal #3
readables.title: Leaving as soon as possible
text: I set out early this morning with high hopes of bringing home some game, but as I moved deeper into the forest, it became clear that there was nothing to be found.
The animal tracks that were once abundant have disappeared, and the woods are eerily quiet.
As I wandered further, I stumbled upon a strange and unsettling sight.
A dead animal carcass lay in the clearing, its body mutilated and twisted in a way that seemed almost unnatural.
I couldn't identify the species, as it appeared to be a grotesque hybrid of several different animals.
I knew I should leave the area and report what I had seen, but I couldn't shake the feeling that I was being watched.
I lingered for a moment, trying to make sense of what I was seeing, before turning and running back to my cabin as fast as I could.
I don't know what to make of this, but I can't shake the feeling that something very wrong is happening in these woods.
I'm not sure I want to stay here much longer.

readables.name: friendNote
readables.label: Friend's Note
readables.title: LATE!!!
text: Unfortunately if you are reading this is because I had to move on before your arrival.
I gonna try to sneak into the Village, the guards are not that bad unless you try to enter building you're not supposed to.
I left some clothes around, maybe you can try them, guards may allow you inside building if you manage to disguise yourself.
Also, there're enough wood, just make fire when needed.
I'm glad you are not so idiotic to move on before reading my note, find me in the Village so we can talk.
